title: Pardoned Cooper, lawyer thank Holcomb for doing 'what Pence couldn’t do'
text:
Pardoned Cooper, lawyer thank Holcomb for doing 'what Pence couldn’t do' Mark Alesia , mark.alesia@indystar.com Published 8:13 p.m.   22 hours ago CLOSE x Share Newly pardoned Keith Cooper and his attorney, Elliot Slosar, talk about Cooper's new freedom. Kelly Wilkinson/IndyStar Buy Photo Keith Cooper was pardoned Thursday. (Photo: Kelly Wilkinson/IndyStar) Buy Photo 554 CONNECT 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
CHICAGO — Newly pardoned Keith Cooper, no longer bearing the label of an armed robber, celebrated his exoneration Friday by saying he wants to give Indiana Gov. Eric Holcomb a "big bear hug." 
Elliot Slosar, Cooper's lawyer, had a much different sentiment for Vice President Mike Pence, Indiana Attorney General Curtis Hill and the Elkhart Police Department. 
Slosar accused Pence of political cowardice for not granting a pardon sooner, Hill of continuing to press a flimsy prosecution and the Elkhart Police Department of corruption, saying he believes there are "many more people in that (Elkhart) county who also faced the same injustice that Keith Cooper faced." 
"We will certainly be back there to expose the truth," Slosar said. 
Holcomb on Thursday pardoned Cooper on a felony conviction stemming from an armed robbery in Elkhart about 20 years ago that he did not commit. 
Cooper was sentenced in 1997 to 40 years in prison, but after serving more than eight years he reached a deal. He could withdraw his petition that sought exoneration and, in exchange, walk out of jail a free man. Cooper agreed. 
The deal was offered by the Elkhart County prosecutor, who was then Hill. He was not the county prosecutor when Cooper was wrongly convicted, but later defended Cooper's conviction when Cooper sought a new trial. 
Hill on Friday declined comment. Pence's office and the Elkhart Police Department did not return phone messages Friday afternoon. 
Holcomb on Thursday said he was "very much at peace" with pardoning Cooper on an armed robbery charge. Facebook A link has been posted to your Facebook feed.
